q: a big loss. "American Idol" returns Wednesday with new judges Steven Tyler and Jennifer Lopez and without the acidic Simon Cowell to keep everyone honest. Jennifer Lopez admits their act will be unlike Simon Cowell 's. We bring a different perspective, I think, than any of the other previous judges really have before, especially if you're speaking about Simon Cowell specifically. We just do, she says. The moves are part of Google Inc. 's plans to streamline decision making and create clearer lines of responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. The changes will be effective on April 4. We've been talking about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making for a long time. By clarifying our individual roles we'll create clearer responsibility and accountability at the top of the company, said Eric Schmidt . Eric Schmidt will continue to act as an advisor to Page and Sergey Brin . However, he will focus externally on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought

been rumored as possible judges on the show. Simon Cowell says feelers are out to certain possible judges, though he would not list their names. Asked about his former Idol pal Abdul, he said, I'm a massive fan of Paula. We honestly haven't made our mind up yet... We're talking to a number of people. Day-to-day adult supervision no longer needed! Eric Schmidt tweeted as the announcement was made on Thursday evening.
